item.title: Bessent tells the FT that struggling China wants 'to pull everybody else down with them'
item.description: Bessent accused China of trying to weaken the global economy by slapping export controls on resources vital for technology.

item.title: CPI inflation report will be released by Labor Department, while other data is delayed by shutdown
item.description: The Labor Department will bring back staff to work on a key inflation report.

item.title: WTO hikes global trade forecast for 2025 â€” but next year doesn't look so good
item.description: Global trade volumes rose sharply in the first half of 2025 as businesses front-loaded imports ahead of higher tariffs.

item.title: The shutdown meant no jobs report. Carlyle's analysis shows it would have been pretty bad
item.description: The firm said its proprietary data showed job growth of just 17,000 for the month, which would be even less than the 22,000 gain in August.

item.title: Missing this pay date may be too much for Trump and Congress to prolong shutdown
item.description: While the sides have dug in their heels regarding the budget, missing a pay period for the military may not be seen as worth the fallout.
